applicability_reasoning: This regulation does not apply to this document for several reasons: 1) The document is a pension scheme rules document that outlines the operation and governance of an executive pension life cover scheme, not a consumer contract. 2) The scheme is specifically for company pensions between employers and employees/directors, not consumer products. This is evidenced by Section 2.2 which states 'An employee or director of the employer shall be eligible for inclusion in the scheme at the employer's discretion.' 3) The document is governed by different legislation, specifically the Pensions Act 1990 and the Taxes Consolidation Act 1997, as mentioned throughout the document. 4) While the document does include contact information in Section 6, this is general contact information rather than consumer dispute resolution information, because this is not a consumer product. 5) The scheme is an occupational pension scheme established by employers for their employees, which falls outside the scope of consumer protection regulations as it is a B2B arrangement.
regulation_title: Information on relevant ombudsman and alternative dispute resolution service to be provided
regulation_text: 61. (1) Prior to entering into a contract with a consumer, a regulated entity shall inform the consumer of the ombudsman, where relevant, and any alternative dispute resolution service other than a relevant ombudsman, that will deal with a complaint in the event t hat the consumer does not accept the decision of the regulated entity's complaints process. (2) Paragraph (1) does not apply to the extent that, prior to entering into a contract with a consumer, the regulated entity is required to inform the consumer, in compliance with any applicable law, of the relevant ombudsman or alternative dispute resolution service, including an ADR entity or out -of- court complaints and redress. (3) For the purposes of this Regulation, "ADR entity" has the meaning given to it in Directive 2013/11/EU of the European Parliament and of the Council of 21 May 201310.
source_name: CENTRAL BANK (SUPERVISION AND ENFORCEMENT) ACT 2013 (SECTION 48) (CONSUMER PROTECTION) REGULATIONS 2025
